section.title: Getting Started
section.p: In front of you is the power of raw elemental magic. In the world exist the following elements:
Fire
Fire causes Flames, in the shape of a Sphere around caster.
Water
Water spawns flowing water, in the shape of a Ball thrown forward.
Air
Air blows things away, in the shape of a Cone in front of the caster.
Earth
Earth endures, ...shape not decided yet.
Light
Light protects and illuminates, the shape is a Beam.
Darkness
Darkness weakens and darkens, the shape is not yet determined.
Life
Life heals and repairs, these spells are Self-cast.
Death
Death breaks and damages, they take the aspect of Curses applied directly to your target.

section.title: Casting Spells
section.p: A spell is a series of elements. Each element has an effect and shape. The order of the elements matters, as their effects change depending on the position within the spell:
- The first element in the spell defines its primary effect, while subsequent elements will apply modifiers to it.
- The last element in the spell will dictate the shape/casting style of the spell.
- Having multiple of the same element one after the other will increase the primary effect, while opposite elements will reduce or cancel this effect.
- A modifier effect will not be applied if the effect is cancelled by the previous element, but the shape will still apply.

To cast a spell, you hold right-click down with a wand or staff equipped, and while holding the button down, press the element keybinds (by default the numbers 1..8, shared by the hotbar slots), in the desired sequence.
Example: HOLD right-click, PRESS 5, PRESS 1, RELEASE right-click.
This combination will cast a light blast, which will place temporary lights all around where you are.
Example: HOLD right-click, PRESS 3, PRESS 5, RELEASE right-click.
This combination will cast a push spell, moving you in the direction you are looking toward.

The wands remember their last spell, so if you release right-click without pressing any key, the same spell will be repeated. The current spell can be cleared by right-clicking while sneaking, although this is rarely needed.

section.title: Extra Storage
section.p: Gemstones can store elemental essences, but you will have to recharge the gemstone in your wands very often if you rely only on that.
You discovered that you can carry more magic by setting gemstones into rings, headbands, and necklaces. They can be equipped via the extra slots added through the Curios mod.
When casting spells, all the combined reserves of magic from your items is accounted, such that you can cast bigger spells, or cast weak spells more often.

section.title: Improved Casting
section.p: Wands are a perfectly good tool, but they are limited in how much essence they can contain.
You have discoverd that you can improve the wand, and effectively double the capacity of the gemstone, by crafting it into a Staff, allowing you to to reach even bigger spells.

section.title: Rituals
section.p: You believe there may be some way to perform complex interactions by making use of structures built in the world.
Sadly, the specifics of the method escape you. You keep that possibility in your mind, maybe in the future you'll find the key.
